attributes.action: House Ukrainian refugees in vacant properties owned by Russian oligarchs.
attributes.additional_details: Transparency International estimate that 100 London properties, worth 1.1 billion £ are owned, through offshore shell companies, by Russian billionaires and oligarchs accused of corruption or linked to the Kremlin. The invasion of Ukraine is illegal under international law and has displaced millions of innocent civilians from their homes. These refugees should therefore be housed within vacant properties owned by the very people responsible for driving them from their homes in the first place.
attributes.background: House Ukrainian refugees in properties owned by Russian oligarchs linked to the kremlin. Establish transparency of ownership, including a comprehensive register of foreign ownership. Any property which the owners fail to provide such transparency should then be used to provide housing for refugees.

rejection.details:
Decisions about housing refugees is an operational decision for the Home Office and individual local authorities, but we have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Seize assets held by anyone with close ties to the Russian government: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/609418

Seize frozen Russian assets and give proceeds to Ukraine to help with rebuilding: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/610119
